content: Yes, you're right. Safe head algorithm got stuck in the R&D phase

author: m.kalinin
content: Right, it's a proof that a block is valid in the view of the network (signified by a randomly sampled subset of validators so we can trust them), this information can be obtained for `latest` block once enough votes are attesting to it. But it doesn't give any guarantee that this block won't be orphaned. This is what safe block algo was supposed to give in the case when a block and a blockchain behind it receives a number of votes that would allow to consider it safe from reorgs
